We have selected 8 of the best offset smokers on the market and we have reviewed them based on their capacity, construction, pricing and multifunctionality.

2. Pit Barrel Cooker

The pit barrel smoker may not seem like a typical offset smoker but for the fact that it heats the food away from the cooking area will qualify it as an offset smoker.

This unique design is a refinement of the ugly drum smoker (UDS) with better quality than the UDS offers.

It is a spacious vertical smoker with a hang ‘n’ cook approach. Using the 8 stainless steel hooks allow you to hang your food while cooking instead of using the common grate approach. This then gives you more space to cook with.

For a vertical barrel, this product is brilliantly constructed of 18-gauge stainless steel and porcelain enamel which has proven to be super durable by many users.

This smoker goes a step further allowing fat juices to drip off onto the lighted fire as it cooks, enhancing the smoky flavors that cook the food.

While it may be pricey and the company is still very young, this is the best offset smoker under $1000.

Plus, the Pit Barrel Cooker has one of the easiest assembling methods that your teenager could put it together for you.

Why should you choose an offset smoker?

Consider its purpose

In our previous reviews, we have talked about the importance of adding smoky flavors to your food. This smoker is specifically built and designed for that purpose.

An offset smoker consists of two separate chambers connected together. One chamber is called the firebox which is where the coals or firewood is burned and a second chamber which holds the food.

The smoke creates in the firebox and then passes through to the other chamber and then through the flew. The smoke is cooled down while it transfers over to the meat chamber creating an offset smoker. Such an amazing technique!

Designed for more food

Typically these smokers are designed to be on a much larger scale of size. These smokers are very common in BBQ competitions and restaurants due to the amount of food they are able to produce.

Don’t let that scare you out of buying one though because offset smokers are for anyone. Just because you have the room to cook all that food, doesn’t mean that you have to, it’s just nice to have the option.
On average, these smokers have the capability to produce a minimum of 20 burgers in one turn this so there is plenty of food to go around.

Do you need an all in one kind of a cooker?

An offset smoker is also equipped with multiple cooking methods; grilling, smoking, searing and roasting are all viable cooking options making this type of smoker an all-in-one offset grill.

This smoker is bound to replace several different appliances such as the oven, grill, stovetop, and smoker. So the question is why wouldn’t you need one?

Are you particular about durability?

Offset smokers are made from quality metals welded together to stand sturdy to the ground.

Considering the fact that these devices are for external use only they are designed to withstand the test of climate changes for a longer life. This smoker is sure to withstand the test of time.

Most of the offset smokers are built to be mobile as well. Some so big they are usually attached to a trailer to allow easy transfer of the smoker from site to site. While others have well built in casters available.

Important qualities you should look out for when purchasing

Is it long lasting?

These smokers are more often than not built out of galvanized steel or double thick iron making them incredibly durable and long lasting.

There are cheaper models on the market made from thinner steel that is not weatherproof as well.

So make sure and research the brand you want to purchase and check to be sure that the materials used are of high quality. You will want to shoot for a minimum lifespan of 4 years to keep you in a safe zone.

Consider your serving size

If the particular smoker does not provide more than 250 square inches of cooking surface area then ditch it for something else.

It will be totally wrong to not have enough food to go around. That would defeat the whole purpose of purchasing an offset smoker.

Consider its price

First of all, these smokers are not small smokers, meaning they do not come cheap. However, this does not mean that the deal is a rip-off, it only means best possible value offset smoker.

Investing in a quality smoker means you will have to pay more but the smoker will definitely live its name up to the price tag.

Investments are meant to serve a lengthier purpose and so should be your best smoker.

This product review balances quality products with good pricing opting for the best choice. There is also information available online to keep you well informed on what the best has to offer.

Are they multifunctional

Offset smokers are built to not only cook large amounts of food at a time but also provide alternative cooking methods should you choose to do so.

They have the option of direct heat and indirect heat to smoke foods creating a whole other form of smoking which is called “cold smoking”. This method is great to use on fish and cured meats.

They also have the ability to bake pastas, pizzas, and casseroles. Or just about anything you put in an oven, you can do the same in one of these smokers. As long as it is not a vertical smoker with an offset firebox, then you also have an option to grill foods.

Here are some of the types we have chosen which have many of these features. After reading this review you will be able to make an educated guess on which offset smoker to purchase!
